item.title: 80pc of strokes preventable through lifestyle modification: Experts
item.description: Nearly 80 per cent of strokes are preventable through lifestyle modifications and controlling high blood pressure, quitting smoking, avoiding unhealthy diets and staying physically active, said experts. The experts said this at the International Stroke Conference 2025 held on Sunday at Bangladesh

item.title: At least two dead as Super Typhoon Fung-wong nears landfall in the Philippines
item.description: At least two people died in the Philippines as Super Typhoon Fung-wong lashed central and eastern parts of the country, with heavy rains and strong winds cutting power in large areas of the Bicol region ahead of its expected landfall in northern Luzon. More than a million people have evacuated vul

item.title: 71 Madrasah teachers, 2 faculty members become British Council-trained teacher educators for English
item.description: The British Council, in collaboration with the Bangladesh Madrasah Teachers’ Training Institute (BMTTI) and Technical and Madrasah Education Division (TMED), has completed an intensive six-day residential Training of Trainers (ToT) programme. Delivered over 28 sessions by nine top English La

item.title: Asif Mahmud plans to stand in February election as an independent
item.description: Local Government Advisor Asif Mahmud Shojib Bhuyain has said he intends to contest in the next parliamentary polls as an independent candidate. On Sunday afternoon, he said, though he has not yet decided from where he will stand, he hopes, “It will be from Dhaka, God willing,” accordin

item.title: Four school students drown in Meherpur lake
item.description: Four school students have died while picking water lilies from a lake in Meherpur Sadar. Meherpur Sadar Upazila administrator (UNO) Khairul Islam said, “The accident occurred around 5:15 pm on Sunday at Mominpur Beel.”

item.title: 6 more die of dengue; 1,195 hospitalised in 24 hours
item.description: The dengue situation in Bangladesh continues to worsen, with six more deaths and 1,195 new hospitalisations recorded across the country in the 24 hours till Sunday morning. According to the Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS), the latest figures bring this year’s total death toll f

item.title: Expand Bangladesh-South Korea cooperation: Seminar
item.description: Speakers at a seminar on Sunday highlighted the importance of expanding cooperation between Bangladesh and South Korea in advanced manufacturing and infrastructure projects in a changing global environment. They talked about roads, ports and power sector projects, strengthening collaboration in di

item.title: Dhaka slams Rajnath Singh’s remarks on Prof Yunus as ‘incorrect, not respectful’
item.description: Bangladesh on Sunday described the recent comments made by Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Chief Adviser Dr Muhammad Yunus as ‘incorrect’ and ‘not respectful of propriety and diplomatic nicety’ and stressed that Bangladesh remains committed to a mutually beneficial

item.title: CID approves charge sheets against Beximco for laundering TK 12 billion
item.description: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) of Police has approved the submission of charge sheets in 17 money-laundering cases filed against Beximco Group Vice Chairman Salman F. Rahman, Chairman A.S.F. Rahman, and several others, over allegations of laundering nearly USD 97 million (approximately

item.title: 25 held in Dhaka over ‘plan to release 100,000 balloons with AL slogans’
item.description: Dhaka Metropolitan Police’s Detective Branch (DB) have arrested 25 leaders and activists of Awami League and its affiliated bodies in separate drives in the capital over 24 hours till 8 am on Sunday for their alleged plan to release 100,000 balloons with Awami League slogans. They had

item.title: Tariff weaponisation poses grave threat to Bangladesh, experts warn
item.description: Bangladesh faces an increasingly precarious trade environment as global tariff regimes grow more volatile and geopolitics reshapes global supply chains, economists and policy analysts warned at a seminar in Dhaka on Sunday. Speaking at the event, titled “Navigating Geopolitical Dynamics: Tow

item.title: ‘Plot graft’: 22 people testify against Hasina, Rehana, Tulip
item.description: A Dhaka court has recorded testimonies of 22 witnesses in three separate cases by the Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) against deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina and members of her family over forgery allegations in the allocation of plots in the Purbachal New Town Project.
